name: .IDX File Extension
summary: Learn about .IDX files and view a list of programs that open them.

instructions: When paired with its accompanying SUB file, an IDX file can be used to play subtitles alongside a movie using DirectVobSub (Windows) or VideoLAN VLC media player (multiplatform).
To use an IDX file as a subtitles file in VLC media player:
Make sure your SUB and IDX file are stored in the same directory.
Begin playing the movie you want to use your IDX file with.
From VLC's menu bar, select Subtitles â†’ Add Subtitle File...
Navigate to and open your IDX file.
Because they are plain text files, you can also open and edit IDX files in any text editor. However, editing an IDX file may cause the subtitles it is linked with to play incorrectly.

The .SRT subtitle format is more common than the VobSub format. Therefore, you might want to convert your VobSub subtitles to the SRT format so you can use them more easily. SubtitleTools.com has a SUB / IDX to SRT converter, called Convert Sub/Idx to Srt, that you can use to convert VobSub subtitles to the SRT format. Keep in mind that you must have both a .SUB file and an IDX file to convert VobSub subtitles to the SRT format.
